newsitem.title: FINLAND: SPONSOR SAYS TO BUY NESTE'S EXEL BUSINESS.
newsitem.headline: SPONSOR SAYS TO BUY NESTE'S EXEL BUSINESS.

text.p: Finnish investment company Sponsor Oy, part of banking group Merita Oy , said in a statement on Tuesday it had signed a letter of intent to buy the operations of Exel Oy from oil and energy group Neste Oy.
Neste later also published a statement about the deal.

Net sales of Exel, a maker of ski sticks, windsurfing board masts and indoor bandy sticks and of industrial profiles, were expected to be around 140 million markka this year, Neste said, adding the unit's profitabiity was good.
"The sale of Exel is part of Neste's strategy to focus on chemicals on resin adhesives for the forest industry and on industrial surface dressings," Neste said.
Sponsor said it had the resources and the will to continue to be active in corporate acquisitions in the future.
